actions.in_committee: House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs

actions.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs. H. Rept. 102-938.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 534.
Mr. Vento moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 5, rule I, the chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed until Sept. 30.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays (2/3 required): 298 - 121 (Roll No. 446).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: To authorize the Secretary of the Interior to establish an Abraham Lincoln Research and Interpretive Center.

summary.text: Amends Federal law to authorize the Secretary of the Interior to establish the Abraham Lincoln Interpretive Center in Illinois, to be added to and administered as part of the Lincoln Home National Historic Site. Sets forth provisions regarding: (1) acquisition of land; (2) construction, operation and maintenance of facilities; (3) cooperative agreements; and (4) documents and artifacts. Authorizes appropriations.

titles.title: To authorize the Secretary of the Interior to establish an Abraham Lincoln Research and Interpretive Center.
